commit.message:
ovpn-cli: remove control packets related code

Control packets are now sent directly using the transport socket instead
of netlink, therefore we can get rid of code sending/receiving packets
via netlink.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

committer Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1706882103 +0100

ovpn-cli: remove control packets related code

Control packets are now sent directly using the transport socket instead
of netlink, therefore we can get rid of code sending/receiving packets
via netlink.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

commit.message:
ovpn-dco: properly declare ovpn_tcp_recvmsg for linux <5.19

The noblock parameter was removed in linux 5.19, therefore every kernel
ealeri than that should have it. Fix ifdef condition to match this
statement.

Reported-by: Jiri Prchal <jiri.prchal@aksignal.cz>
Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

committer Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1701078711 +0100

ovpn-dco: properly declare ovpn_tcp_recvmsg for linux <5.19

The noblock parameter was removed in linux 5.19, therefore every kernel

commit.message:
ovpn-dco: Fix non-RHEL kernel builds

Red Hat Enterprise Linux kernels provides helper macros for
detecting the distribution version.  This is needed here as
Red Hat backports features and changes from newer kernels
into the older kernel baseline.  Therefore the RHEL kernel
features may not be correctly identified by the Linux kernel
version alone.

To be able to build ovpn-dco on non-RHEL kernels, we need
these helper macros defined.  And we want the result to
always be true, to not disable the other kernel version
checks

Signed-off-by: David Sommerseth <davids@openvpn.net>
Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

verification.payload:
tree 63584752f89d764901030ba147f51051d73e2c49
parent eb4439403d344f0a21909d50b4f2c94ee00c9ed2
author David Sommerseth <davids@openvpn.net> 1700140092 +0100
committer Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1700143915 +0100

ovpn-dco: Fix non-RHEL kernel builds

Red Hat Enterprise Linux kernels provides helper macros for
detecting the distribution version.  This is needed here as
Red Hat backports features and changes from newer kernels
into the older kernel baseline.  Therefore the RHEL kernel
features may not be correctly identified by the Linux kernel
version alone.

To be able to build ovpn-dco on non-RHEL kernels, we need
these helper macros defined.  And we want the result to
always be true, to not disable the other kernel version
checks

Signed-off-by: David Sommerseth <davids@openvpn.net>
Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

commit.message:
ovpn-dco: rework RHEL compatibility checks and include RHEL9.3

Testing for RHEL kernels is much easier if done with their C defines
that work pretty much the same as the kernel LINUX_KERNEL_VERSION
defines. Therefore stop parsing /etc/redhat-release.

At the same time, extend the checks to ensure compatibility with RHEL9.3
that was just released.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

verification.payload:
tree 579042d91183beae2da58a73fd584fc8b5b0e8bb
parent 0613e71884c92acbb964f36813a810104e525c7f
author Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1700128043 +0100
committer Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1700133807 +0100

ovpn-dco: rework RHEL compatibility checks and include RHEL9.3

Testing for RHEL kernels is much easier if done with their C defines
that work pretty much the same as the kernel LINUX_KERNEL_VERSION
defines. Therefore stop parsing /etc/redhat-release.

At the same time, extend the checks to ensure compatibility with RHEL9.3
that was just released.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

commit.message:
ovpn-dco: warn if peer is dead in ovpn_tcp_read_sock()

When in ovpn_tcp_read_sock(), we should already be holding a
reference to the related peer object, therefore it is implied
that the next ovpn_peer_hold() should always succed.

Warn if this does not happen.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

verification.payload:
tree 826d137e62a9419f2bcbb3458b73fe2bf2f014d8
parent 7b7a28fcb0c244c7182922f7c83cb09bcd840c84
author Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1698971124 +0100
committer Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1698971124 +0100

ovpn-dco: warn if peer is dead in ovpn_tcp_read_sock()

When in ovpn_tcp_read_sock(), we should already be holding a
reference to the related peer object, therefore it is implied
that the next ovpn_peer_hold() should always succed.

Warn if this does not happen.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

commit.message:
ovpn-dco: fix refcount imbalance upon RX in case of full ring

When the RX ring is full ovpn_recv() will stop and return -ENOSPC.
At this point the incoming packet is dropped.

However, a reference to the peer object is obtained right before
invoking ovpn_recv() and failing to drop it will result in a reference
imbalance.

Make sure to drop reference in case of ring being full and prevent
imbalance.

NOTE: this problem only existed in the TCP codepath

Fix suggested by David Lam <david@openvpn.net>

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

verification.payload:
tree 6b31445cc087d753c897938b2e9428f6e0296380
parent dba96d203f960356b477291d6a58d30fc096fbe4
author Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1698878979 +0100
committer Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1698914201 +0100

ovpn-dco: fix refcount imbalance upon RX in case of full ring

When the RX ring is full ovpn_recv() will stop and return -ENOSPC.
At this point the incoming packet is dropped.

However, a reference to the peer object is obtained right before
invoking ovpn_recv() and failing to drop it will result in a reference
imbalance.

Make sure to drop reference in case of ring being full and prevent
imbalance.

NOTE: this problem only existed in the TCP codepath

Fix suggested by David Lam <david@openvpn.net>

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

commit.message:
ovpn-dco: include new GSO header file

GSO code has ben moved to its own files, therefore a new header
needs to be included accordingly.

This patch also provides some compat files so that ovpn-dco can
continue to compile also on older kernels.

Fixes: https://github.com/OpenVPN/ovpn-dco/issues/42
Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

committer Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1692217145 +0200

ovpn-dco: include new GSO header file

GSO code has ben moved to its own files, therefore a new header
needs to be included accordingly.

This patch also provides some compat files so that ovpn-dco can
continue to compile also on older kernels.

Fixes: https://github.com/OpenVPN/ovpn-dco/issues/42

commit.message:
ovpn-dco: add compat check for RHEL9

RHEL backports features to older kernels, therefore
the kernel version alone is not enough to tell us if
a feature exists or not. For this reason sometimes we
need to add an extra check specific to RHEL.

This is what we need for RHEL9.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

ovpn-dco: add compat check for RHEL9

RHEL backports features to older kernels, therefore
the kernel version alone is not enough to tell us if
a feature exists or not. For this reason sometimes we
need to add an extra check specific to RHEL.

This is what we need for RHEL9.

commit.message:
ovpn-dco: fix compat check for sock_is_readable on RHEL8

As for other parts of the code, RHEL8 ship an old kernel, but with a lot
of backported code from more recent kernels.

When our compat code tries to redefine some parts that fall into the
above, we will get an error because RHEL8 is fooling us regarding the
actual code version.

This is now happening for the definition of sock_is_readable.
Add extra EL8 check to make sure the compat code is not used for RHEL8
in this case.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

verification.payload:
tree 3beabd9b37cc76c65b08ed2dfbfa0228cc9228a7
parent 1c2c84e99d0c1513db38ac7a3858f21229906fd7
author Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1679924032 +0200
committer Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1679924032 +0200

ovpn-dco: fix compat check for sock_is_readable on RHEL8

As for other parts of the code, RHEL8 ship an old kernel, but with a lot
of backported code from more recent kernels.

When our compat code tries to redefine some parts that fall into the
above, we will get an error because RHEL8 is fooling us regarding the
actual code version.

This is now happening for the definition of sock_is_readable.
Add extra EL8 check to make sure the compat code is not used for RHEL8
in this case.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

commit.message:
ovpn-dco: allocate a single queue

Having multiple queues when all data is processed internally in a single
queue does not really make sense.

Convert device to single TX/RX queue.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

commit.message:
ovpn-dco: do not implement state_change TCP callback

OpenVPN in userspace keeps track of the TCP and will react to events
directly, therefore there is no need to override the state_change
callback and trigger yet another event.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

verification.payload:
tree f3738841538f808884d457905fadb4fe7ad94766

committer Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1678318002 +0100

ovpn-dco: do not implement state_change TCP callback

commit.message:

bytes, therefore we must be able to accept such larger sizes.

commit.message:
ovpn-dco: remove dead code using netlink to forward control packets

Control packets are now redirected to userspace using transport specific
logic in their respective handlers.
For this reason it is now possible to erase the code sending control
packets using netlink.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

verification.payload:
tree 29f7e6d57b472b837b3fa57a562b1ff0ede1e881
parent 875d40ce30795c83f4580344ee254b58d04978d2
author Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1677023266 +0100
committer Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1677626447 +0100

ovpn-dco: remove dead code using netlink to forward control packets

Control packets are now redirected to userspace using transport specific
logic in their respective handlers.
For this reason it is now possible to erase the code sending control
packets using netlink.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

commit.message:
ovpn-dco: tcp - send control packets to userspace via transport socket

Same as UDP, also for TCP connections we want to send non-data packets
to userspace via the original transport socket.

In TCP this is a bit more complicated than UDP because the whole is
stream oriented.

The implementation therefore works as such:
* override the data-ready socket callback;
* when the callback fires, read data from the sockt directly;
* override sock_is_readable and recvmsg socket callbacks;
* when new data is ready to go to userspace, ensure that
  sock_is_readable returns true;
* recvmsg will then be invoked by userspace and it should transfer
  the data that was previously prepared.

NOTE: the last 2 callbacks are part of the sk_prot member of the sock
structure and therefore we had to create our own static copy of tcp_sock
before overriding them. Directly saving their pointers in sock->sk_prot
will lead to changing tcp_prot which is shared system wide with all TCP
sockets.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

verification.payload:
tree 7d7101fbe3cbe2e774580d867eae32c09a0759a8
parent be82d0b22a6e411fd4301345732b7d0569370785
author Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1677022929 +0100
committer Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1677626446 +0100

ovpn-dco: tcp - send control packets to userspace via transport socket

Same as UDP, also for TCP connections we want to send non-data packets
to userspace via the original transport socket.

In TCP this is a bit more complicated than UDP because the whole is
stream oriented.

The implementation therefore works as such:
* override the data-ready socket callback;
* when the callback fires, read data from the sockt directly;
* override sock_is_readable and recvmsg socket callbacks;
* when new data is ready to go to userspace, ensure that
  sock_is_readable returns true;
* recvmsg will then be invoked by userspace and it should transfer
  the data that was previously prepared.

NOTE: the last 2 callbacks are part of the sk_prot member of the sock
structure and therefore we had to create our own static copy of tcp_sock
before overriding them. Directly saving their pointers in sock->sk_prot
will lead to changing tcp_prot which is shared system wide with all TCP
sockets.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

commit.message:
ovpn-dco: udp - send control packets to userspace via transport socket

Instead of relying on NetLink for sending control packets to userspace,
we can directly inform the stack to forward the current skb to via the
same transport socket that we used to receive it.

This way userspace does not need to listen on NetLink but will process
control packets as if DCO was not there at all.

Intercept non-data packets in the UDP handler and redirect them
immediately.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>

parent 3b3df4a3abadfbb8c903469d08e51f577e8e3bd7
author Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1677019992 +0100
committer Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net> 1677019992 +0100

ovpn-dco: udp - send control packets to userspace via transport socket

Instead of relying on NetLink for sending control packets to userspace,
we can directly inform the stack to forward the current skb to via the
same transport socket that we used to receive it.

This way userspace does not need to listen on NetLink but will process
control packets as if DCO was not there at all.

Intercept non-data packets in the UDP handler and redirect them
immediately.

Signed-off-by: Antonio Quartulli <antonio@openvpn.net>
